result.text: You know what's weird about marriage? It's like a game of Jenga. (pause) You start with this perfect little tower, and then you take turns removing pieces until it all comes crashing down.

My wife and I were at the park the other day, and we saw a guy playing fetch with his dog. But here's the thing: the dog wasn't even bringing the ball back. (pause) He was just running around, sniffing things, completely ignoring the guy.
I turned to my wife and said, 'You know what? That's us in our relationship.' (pause) She just laughed and said, 'No, we're not like that.'
I love how restaurants put 'artisanal' on their menus. (pause) Like, what does that even mean? 'This bread was made by a guy who wears a beret.'

I went to a coffee shop the other day, and they had a sign that said, 'Please do not order a Venti Iced Coffee.' (pause) I'm like, 'What, are you worried that I'm going to order a Venti Iced Coffee and then just leave it on the counter and walk out?'
I turned to the barista and said, 'You know what? I'm going to order a Venti Iced Coffee, and then I'm going to leave it on the counter and walk out.'
You know what's wild about getting older? It's like your body is a rental car. (pause) You pay for the insurance, and then you're like, 'I'm good, I'm good, I'm good.'
I was at the doctor the other day, and he said, 'You know what? You need to start exercising more.' (pause) I said, 'What kind of exercise?' He said, 'Well, have you ever thought about yoga?'
I said, 'Yoga? I'm 40 years old. I'm not doing yoga. I'm doing whatever it takes to get out of bed in the morning.'
I love how people say, 'I'm not a morning person.' (pause) Like, what does that even mean? 'I'm not a morning person' is just code for 'I'm a lazy person.'

I was at a restaurant the other day, and the hostess said, 'Welcome to the early bird special.' (pause) I said, 'What's the early bird special?' She said, 'It's a special menu for people who eat breakfast at 5 o'clock.'
I said, 'You know what? That's not a special menu, that's just a regular menu for people who are losers.'
You know what's weird about being an adult? It's like you're a kid again, but instead of playing with Legos, you're playing with a mortgage.

I was at the bank the other day, and they had a sign that said, 'Please do not make large withdrawals.' (pause) I'm like, 'What, are you worried that I'm going to withdraw all my money and then just walk out?'
I turned to the teller and said, 'You know what? I'm going to withdraw all my money and then I'm going to walk out.'
I love how people say, 'I'm so busy.' (pause) Like, what does that even mean? 'I'm so busy' is just code for 'I'm not doing anything productive.'
I was at a coffee shop the other day, and there was a guy sitting there, staring at his phone. (pause) I'm like, 'What's he doing? Is he playing a game? Is he checking his email?'
I turned to the barista and said, 'You know what? I'm going to go talk to him.' (pause) I walked over to him and said, 'What's going on? What's so interesting?' He said, 'I'm just checking my email.'
I love how people say, 'I'm not a fan of technology.' (pause) Like, what does that even mean? 'I'm not a fan of technology' is just code for 'I'm a dinosaur.'
I was at a restaurant the other day, and they had a sign that said, 'Please do not use your phone.' (pause) I'm like, 'What, are you worried that I'm going to take a picture of the food and
